citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has yet to develop a written program of veterinary care for the avian species on-hand at the facility. The
written program of veterinary care affirms both entities (facility and attending veterinarian) have a clear understanding of
their respective roles to provide appropriate care for the species housed. The facility should ensure that the written
program of veterinary care is available for review during all USDA inspections, with the documented arrangements to
include regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the facility.

The facility has not maintained complete acquisition and disposition records for one ferret and one opossum temporarily
housed at the facility. Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility and all records of
disposition, are necessary to accurately track and identify animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the
detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new site.
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or
disposition, the species of animal and the number of animals involved.

The facility has not documented its annual contingency plan review for the 2023 calendar year. While the facility
representative stated the annual review was conducted in 2023, the last date notated in their records was December 19th,
2022. Reviewing the outlined plan in place ensures the facility has assessed the current plan for any needed amendments
to better prepare for unexpected disasters or events, as well as a detailed strategy to address instructions for, but not
limited to: animal evacuation, sheltering-in-place, and backup provisions for husbandry and food/watering supplies,
sanitation, and ventilation. The facility shall develop and document an appropriate contingency plan available for review
upon USDA inspections.
Correct by January 10, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a written environmental enhancement plan for the birds housed at the facility. Maintaining a
documented plan ensures satisfactory provisions are in place to fitly promote and sustain the psychological well-being
and needs of the avian species housed. An enrichment plan must be developed, documented, followed, and approved by
the attending veterinarian, in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and currently accepted professional
standards.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
